description: Apps for individual users - productivity, lifestyle, entertainment

examples.title: Habit Tracker with Accountability Partner Matching

facets.audience: Adults 25-45 trying to build habits (exercise, reading, meditation) who struggle with solo motivation
facets.jtbd: Stay consistent with habits through social accountability without the awkwardness of asking friends
facets.differentiator: Anonymous matching with similar-goal strangers, daily check-ins, streak competitions
facets.monetization: Free basic tracking, $5/mo for premium matching and group challenges
facets.distribution: Habit/productivity subreddits, TikTok transformation content, podcast sponsorships

examples.why_good: Evergreen problem (habits are hard), social loop (accountability partners), clear monetization (premium features)
examples.score_rationale: Moderate feasibility (matching algorithm needs tuning), large market (everyone has habits), but low moats (easy to copy)

examples.title: Micro-Journal with AI Reflection Prompts

facets.audience: Busy professionals who want journaling benefits but don't have time for long-form writing
facets.jtbd: Get mental clarity in 2 minutes/day with guided micro-prompts that adapt to your mood
facets.differentiator: AI learns your patterns and suggests personalized prompts, weekly insight summaries
facets.distribution: Mental health influencers, app store optimization, wellness newsletter sponsorships

examples.why_good: Growing market (mental wellness), low friction (2 min/day), AI angle for personalization
examples.score_rationale: High feasibility (simple app + LLM prompts), fast value (works day 1), but crowded market (many journal apps)
